title: Wallet: explore streamlining the various wallet models spread across different sections

milestone.description:
**1. Complete initial airdrop functionality**
- Airdrop history screens
- Ability to airdrop based on in-Community activity (No. of msg, No. msg in time range, joining a community, length of community membership)  Ability to combine multiple attributes into an airdrop
- Ability to token gate airdrops
- Live airdrop gas estimation when setting up airdrop

**2. Community Admin functionality enhancements**
- optional service to once a month auto-kick all members who haven't been online for between 30 and 60 days (e.g. auto-kick members whose profile information like Name, Avatar, etc... can no longer be fetched)

**3.  IPFS service for community minted NFTs and other binary community assets**

- In order for NFT tokens minted in our UI to be correctly displayed with all metadata on OpenSea, their assets need to be stored in IPFS (because IPFS is supported by OpenSea)

- Will work something like this: IPFS pinning server is integrated into Status Desktop. When a community mints a NFT, the associated assets are IPFS pinned by the community control node.  The community control node then sends a 'user invisible message' to all other community members via Waku, and the Status Desktop installs of all community members then fetch the NFT assets and pin them as well.  This means that every member of a community that is running Status Desktop will always be 'IPFS pinning' all assets related to the community, so that as long as one community member that uses Status Desktop is online, the assets are guaranteed to be available via IPFS.

- Use a similar scheme to the above could be used for other community assets (that are not related to token minting) in the future like: Community banner image, community icon, community description, etc...

- Use a similar scheme to the above could be used for status user data in the future.  Status users pin assets related to their profile (banner image, avatar, showcase contents) using IPFS, and all of the user's mutual contacts also pin that user's profile data.  Must incorporate a setting so that users can opt-out of pinning their mutual contact's profile data.

**4. QR scanner**
- Needed for private key transfer
- Ethereum key QRs (send modal triggered)
- User Share URL in a QR (opens user profile dialogue) 
- Community and Channel inside Community URL in QRs (takes user to Community or Channel in Community)


**5. Telegram history import into a single channel in an existing community**


**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account

2. Advanced transaction signing

body:
### Description
 Using this task to explore how we can improve the wallet modules across sections such as Browser, Wallet, Community, Settings etc.

Currently we have seprate models in settings, community and wallet , however some of these could be shared. This task will used as a place to explore possible options and find a solution that works best.

We’ve started the exploration understanding which are the **use cases** consumers of data coming from `src/app_service/service/token/service.nim` and also which is the data coming from it (being this data all **pure list of tokens** from **supported app sources** (nowadays _uniswap, status_ and _custom_ lists)).

**App use cases:**
-
Definition of app use cases in a high level way:
- To add new `permission` in a community via `Holding dropdown`.
- To validate and avoid repetition of `name` and `symbol` whenever a new community token is minted.
- To display all tokens from a specific source in `Wallet / Settings / Manage tokens / Tokens List Tab`.

**Goal:**
-
All of these use cases will need the same data source but UI representation will be different, so the aim of this analysis is:
- Identify if service can present data in a better/easy/basic and generic way and try to avoid data filtering at this point if it’s just a visual representation issue. 
- Identify which are the models needed and try to minimise them designing them in a way that they can be reused across different views avoiding repetition of code and uncertainty when deciding which is the real source of information for each use case. Models should relay only in 1 source of truth, that means, data provided by the service.
- Analyse current stores definition, only the ones affected by the specific service use cases, and expose the new models in a single place.

**Subtasks:**
-
 Here the subtasks needed to go through and work on all explained points:
- [ ] Definition of new service, wallet submodule, controller, view and models (flat tokens list and by symbol tokens list). Also add these new models in the correct qml `store`:  [Ongoing draft PR ](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/12489)
- [ ] `TokenType` Enum unification accross all app layers (including nim and qml code)
- [ ] Generic Cpp model class for dealing with joins in UI layer
- [ ] Replace existing model used in `Community / Permissions` and do the needed cleanups
- [ ] TBD

**NOTE:** After this example is fully covered, next step will be exploring `src/app_service/service/wallet_account/service.nim` and try to follow same approach.
